attributes.action: Intervene to resolve pay disputes across the Civil Service.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
On March 30th, a number of government departments are taking both strike
action and action short of a strike because of imposed pay awards in
2006. These imposed awards represent a massive pay cut for low paid
civil servants.  

This action is being taken as a last resort and reflects the fact that
levels of frustration are high and morale is at an all time low. 

At the heart of these disputes is the Chancellor's policy of public
sector pay restraint which states that public sector pay settlements
must not exceed 2% and delegated pay with over 220 different sets of pay
negotiations across the civil service. It is right and fair that the
Government now return to a system of national pay bargaining and
coherent Civil Service pay (with members having increases that at least
match inflation and reasonable pay progression). 

We call on the PM to intervene and resolve these disputes by awarding
fair pay to his Governments’ own employees.
